params.amount: Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)
Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)
Amount of bad debt to cover (mUSD, 18 decimals)

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

healthFactorUnsafe(address).details: Used by LiquidationEngine so liquidations proceed during >20% price crashes. Without this, healthFactor() reverts via getValueUsd() circuit breaker, blocking all liquidations exactly when they are most needed.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.user: The borrower whose remaining debt is uncollectible

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.amount: Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals) Removed whenNotPaused  users must always be able to repay debt, even during a pause, to avoid unfair liquidation from accruing interest.

repayFor(address,uint256).details: Allows LeverageVault to repay user debt when closing positions

params.amount: Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals) Removed whenNotPaused  repayment must always be available.
params.user: The user whose debt to repay

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

socializeBadDebt(uint256,address[]).details: Socializes bad debt by proportionally reducing each active borrower's debt, maintaining the invariant sum(user_debts) == totalBorrows. Without proportional reduction, totalBorrows drops below user sums, breaking interest accrual math (overallocation via proportional share).

params.amount: Amount of bad debt to socialize
params.borrowers: Array of active borrower addresses whose debt should be reduced

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

totalDebt(address).details: Uses pos.principal + pos.accruedInterest (total debt) as interest base, matching _accrueInterest() execution. Previously used only pos.principal, causing the view to understate pending interest vs what _accrueInterest actually charges.

params.amount: Amount to withdraw Checks health BEFORE withdrawal (CEI pattern)

badDebt().notice: Accumulated bad debt from underwater liquidations (unbacked mUSD)

badDebtCovered().notice: Total bad debt covered by protocol reserves or external injection

borrowCapacity(address).notice: Get total borrow capacity for a user (public wrapper)

borrowFor(address,uint256).notice: Borrow mUSD on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)

coverBadDebt(uint256).notice: Cover bad debt by burning mUSD from protocol reserves. Admin sends mUSD to this contract, which is burned to reduce the unbacked supply. Reduces the badDebt accumulator accordingly.

cumulativeBadDebt().notice: Total bad debt ever recorded (for analytics, never decremented)

getCurrentBorrowRate().notice: Get current annual borrow rate in BPS

getCurrentSupplyRate().notice: Get current annual supply rate in BPS

getTotalSupply().notice: Get total supply used for utilization calculation

getUtilizationRate().notice: Get current utilization rate in BPS

healthFactor(address).notice: Get health factor for a user (public view)

healthFactorUnsafe(address).notice: Health factor using unsafe oracle (bypasses circuit breaker)

interestRateBps().notice: Fallback fixed rate if model not set (legacy compatibility)

lastGlobalAccrualTime().notice: Last time global interest was accrued

maxBorrow(address).notice: Get maximum additional borrow amount for a user

recordBadDebt(address).notice: Record bad debt from underwater liquidation. Called by LiquidationEngine after a liquidation exhausts all collateral on a borrower who still has residual debt. Writes off the user's position and moves the shortfall into the badDebt accumulator.

reduceDebt(address,uint256).notice: Called by LiquidationEngine or LeverageVault to reduce a user's debt after seizure/emergency close Added nonReentrant to match all other state-modifying debt functions Allow LEVERAGE_VAULT_ROLE to call for emergency debt cleanup

repayFor(address,uint256).notice: Repay mUSD debt on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)

requestInterestRateModel(address).notice: Propose new interest rate model (48h delay)

requestMinDebt(uint256).notice: Propose new min debt threshold (48h delay)

smusd().notice: SMUSD vault to receive interest payments

socializeBadDebt(uint256,address[]).notice: Socialize remaining bad debt by reducing totalBorrows. This effectively distributes the loss across all borrowers by slightly reducing the interest base. Should only be used as a last resort when reserves are insufficient.

totalBorrows().notice: Global total borrows across all users

totalDebt(address).notice: Get total debt (principal + accrued interest) for a user

totalInterestPaidToSuppliers().notice: Total interest paid to suppliers (for analytics)

unpause().notice: Unpause borrowing and repayments Require DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE for separation of duties

unroutedInterest().notice: Interest that accrued as debt but couldn't be minted (supply cap hit)

withdrawCollateral(address,uint256).notice: Withdraw collateral (only if position stays healthy)

withdrawReserves(address,uint256).notice: Withdraw accumulated protocol reserves Reserves are accounting entries for the protocol's share of interest. Instead of minting unbacked mUSD (which dilutes the peg), we try to mint within the supply cap. If the cap is hit, the withdrawal fails gracefully. Admin should coordinate with supply cap management before withdrawing.
